channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Just thinking out loud, why not send American troops into Russia. This is close to Alaska. https://t.co/307m0wYz59
Photos from Ukraine: What it looks like after the Russian invasion. https://t.co/UItJ68Puj5
Russian police detains hundreds in anti-war, pro-Ukraine protests. https://t.co/WyktkJIzCV

Comment to CNN: Yes, right now Biden is leader of the free world, but a couple of years ago our president was on the other team, and not too far down the road, if things don't change radically, we'll be changing teams again. Don't forget that context.
That's where Putin has fun. He can screw with our political system, but it appears we have no power in the other direction. We can't give him a problem at home.
@KenSmith thinking aloud is good.
@tom_peters if we're lucky, that's all it is.
@Irizaurus we should be flooding that zone too.

@KenSmith But what does that get you if the social media is twitter, which already has a lists feature. It would be hard to sell that as an improvement, esp not in 2022 when feeds are not leading edge and right now even twitter doesn't support them.
@themexican Curious about that last part. Where do Russian state channels heavily influence what people see? Certainly not in YouTube or Instagram?
@iolairemcfadden oy that sucks

Shouldn't we be figuring out how to communicate directly to the Russian people, the way Zelensky was trying to last night? Why don't we have their equivalent of Fox News? It seems they have access to some of our networks? Maybe one of the big news orgs could research that?
Basic question: What kind of media access do Russian people have?
For example, if you're in Russia can you read this tweet?
I'm guessing not. But I don't know.
The Financial Times is making coverage of the war in Ukraine free. https://t.co/BXKhUpOmSr
Russia Deploys Mobile Crematoriums. https://t.co/bbXXAtRJ1l
GOP Leaders Try to Ignore Trump on Ukraine. https://t.co/BGS3tIMPAz
Russian invasion of Ukraine throws world into new era of upheaval. https://t.co/g1KMKVHb0Q
The red state Senate race where loyalty to Trump is proving costly. #utah https://t.co/Mguz9PmBYo
We invaded Iraq with as little provocation as Putin has for invading Ukraine. Which led to this charming moment. https://t.co/6uu9vm57vG
@dsearls The sanctions aren't his nightmare -- I think this is. https://t.co/yvZyOen97m
Video of bombs dropping in Ukraine. https://t.co/EGfua9fmg8
Russia's Putin announces military operation in Ukraine. https://t.co/b80n1hClfg
Ukrainian President Zelensky says Putin has ordered invasion as country prepares for war. https://t.co/JmYzgsHHDi

Putin is so clever, but this is just the beginning of his war, when presumably his generals and troops are all gung ho. Maybe they'll even take Kyiv. And Putin can have a Mission Accomplished moment. Then what? ðŸ˜€ https://t.co/CPSaIXMwLJ

Another thought. The web and Linux has never had the system-level scripting we had on the Mac 25 years ago. Apple, just like the music industry with Napster, couldn't think of anything to do but crush it. Didn't fit in with their philosophy. We'll try it again.

Of course people would pay for music. Napster did in one year what the music industry on its own would never have done. I kept saying -- people are talking about music in the supermarket for crying out loud! We'd pay anything for this. https://t.co/jZBSJRohQO
